intro: Phyllangium distylis, commonly known as the two-styled phyllangium, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its distinctive floral morphology, featuring two distinct styles in its flowers. The plant exhibits a complex reproductive strategy, with separate male and female flowers on the same inflorescence. Its leaves are compound, with a feathery appearance, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological specificity, Phyllangium distylis is considered a species of conservation concern.
